v.v: The gloom will be dispelled from her who was in anguish.
The people who walked in darkness have seen a great light;
You have multiplied the nation; you have increased their joy.
For the yoke of his burden, the beam across his shoulder,
For every boot treading in the tumult
For to us a child has been born, to us a son has been given;
Of the increase of his government and of peace there will be no end,
The Lord sent a word against Jacob, and it fell on Israel.
All the people will know, even Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria, who say in pride and with an arrogant heart,
“The bricks have fallen, but we will rebuild with chiseled stone; the sycamores have been cut down, but we will put cedars in their place.”
Therefore Yahweh will raise up against him Rezin, his adversary, and will stir up his enemies,
the Arameans on the east, and the Philistines on the west. They will devour Israel with open mouth.
Yet the people will not turn to him who struck them, nor will they seek Yahweh of hosts.
Therefore Yahweh will cut off from Israel head and tail, palm branch and reed, in one day.
The leader and the noble man are the head; and the prophet that teaches lies is the tail.
Those who lead this people lead them astray, and those who are led by them are swallowed up.
Therefore the Lord will not rejoice over their young men nor will he have compassion on their fatherless and widows,
Wickedness burns like a fire; it devours the briers and thorns;
Through the fury of Yahweh of hosts the land is scorched, and the people are like fuel for the fire.
They will grab food on the right hand but still be hungry; they will eat food on the left hand but will not be satisfied.
Manasseh will devour Ephraim, and Ephraim, Manasseh; and they together will attack Judah.

v: In an earlier time he humiliated
the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali,
but in the later time he will make it glorious, the way to the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.
those who have lived in the land of the shadow of death, the light has shone on them.
They rejoice before you like the joy at harvest time,
as men rejoice when they divide the plunder.
the rod of his oppressor, you have shattered as on the day of Midian.
and the garments rolled in blood
will be burned, fuel for the fire.
and the rule will be on his shoulder;
and his name will be called Wonderful Counselor,
Mighty God, Everlasting Father,
Prince of Peace.
as he rules on the throne of David, and over his kingdom,
to establish it and sustain it
with justice and with righteousness from this time onward and for evermore.
The zeal of Yahweh of hosts will do this.
In all these things, his anger does not subside; instead, his hand is still stretched out.
since every one is godless and an evildoer, and every mouth speaks foolish things.
In all these things, his anger does not subside; instead, his hand is still stretched out.
it even burns the thickets of the forest, which rise in a column of smoke.
No man spares his brother.
Each will even eat the flesh of his own arm.
In all these things, his anger does not subside; instead, his hand is still stretched out.
